IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: THE PUTNAM EXISTS TO: PRESERVE OUR REGION'S TREASURES - TO CARE FOR AND UTILIZE THEM TO ILLUMINATE OUR HUMAN AND NATURAL HISTORY, AND TO EVOKE THE MEMORIES AND STORIES THE ARTIFACTS AND SPECIMENS TELL. EDUCATE PEOPLE OF ALL AGES IN IMMERSIVE AND LASTING WAYS WITH COMBINED "HANDS-ON, MINDS ON" EXPERIENCES THAT ONLY THE PUTNAM CAN PROVIDE. CONNECT PEOPLE TO EACH OTHER AND TO THE HISTORY AND SCIENCE THAT SHAPE THE CULTURES AND ENVIRONMENTS OF THE EARTH.
IRS990.MissionDesc: THE PUTNAM EXISTS TO: PRESERVE OUR REGION'S TREASURES - TO CARE FOR AND UTILIZE THEM TO ILLUMINATE OUR HUMAN AND NATURAL HISTORY, AND TO EVOKE THE MEMORIES AND STORIES THE ARTIFACTS AND SPECIMENS TELL. EDUCATE PEOPLE OF ALL AGES IN IMMERSIVE AND LASTING WAYS WITH COMBINED "HANDS-ON, MINDS ON" EXPERIENCES THAT ONLY THE PUTNAM CAN PROVIDE. CONNECT PEOPLE TO EACH OTHER AND TO THE HISTORY AND SCIENCE THAT SHAPE THE CULTURES AND ENVIRONMENTS OF THE EARTH.
IRS990.Desc: GIANT SCREEN THEATER: THE PUTNAM'S GIANT SCREEN THEATER OFFERS EDUCATIONAL AND TOPICAL FILMS AND PRESENTATIONS. EXAMPLES INCLUDE INTO AMERICA'S WILD, SUPERPOWER DOGS, BACK FROM THE BRINK, VOLCANOES 3D, OCEANS: OUR BLUE PLANET 3D, AND WILD AFRICA 3D. THE FILMS AND PRESENTATIONS ALLOW VIEWERS TO SEE NATURE IN ALL ITS GLORY, TO LEARN ABOUT HISTORY AND OTHER CULTURES, AND TO TRAVEL TO ALL PARTS OF THE WORLD. IN AN ERA WHEN ENVIRONMENTAL AWARENESS IS PART OF THE DAILY CONVERSATION AND GLOBAL CULTURES ARE INCREASINGLY INTERACTING VIA TECHNOLOGY, FILMS THAT ENLIGHTEN AND EDUCATE THE PUBLIC ABOUT A VARIETY OF ENVIRONMENTS AND CULTURES ARE SIGNIFICANT TO OUR ABILITY TO CO-EXIST PRODUCTIVELY.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: EXHIBITS AND EDUCATION: THE MUSEUM OFFERS PERMANENT AND CHANGING INTERACTIVE, IMPRESSIVE EXHIBITS, A HANDS-ON SCIENCE CENTER, AND EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS RELATED TO HISTORY, CULTURES, AND SCIENCE. EXAMPLES INCLUDE ANNE FRANK EXHIBIT, JUNKRAFT, POLLINATORS AND KEVA PLANKS EXHIBITS, AN INNOVATION CENTER WITH FABRICATION LAB, CODING CLASSES, OCEAN EXPERIENCE, ANCIENT EGYPT AND OUR REGION AND THE CIVIL WAR. INTERACTION WITH ACTUAL ARTIFACTS AND EDUCATORS IN "CHARACTER" PROVIDE DYNAMIC LEARNING EXPERIENCES AND REAL CONNECTIONS THAT CANNOT BE OBTAINED FROM TEXTBOOKS OR THE INTERNET. THESE EXPERIENCES STIMULATE THE DESIRE FOR MORE KNOWLEDGE AND EXPLORATION.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: VISITOR SERVICES: BETWEEN THE GIANT SCREEN THEATER, EXHIBITS, AND EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS, THE MUSEUM HOSTED MORE THAN 85,000 PEOPLE THIS YEAR. CUSTOMER SERVICE STAFF AND AMENITIES LOCATED IN THE MUSEUM'S GRAND LOBBY SPACE SUPPORT AND ENHANCE THE OVERALL VISITOR EXPERIENCE.

ProgSrvcAccomActyOtherGrp.Desc: COLLECTIONS AND CURATORIAL SERVICES: AN IMPORTANT PART OF THE MUSEUM'S MISSIONS IS PRESERVING THE COMMUNITY'S HISTORY. THE MUSEUM HOUSES APPROXIMATELY 170,000 CATALOGED ITEMS IN ITS PERMANENT COLLECTION. THESE ITEMS ARE EXPERTLY CARED FOR, ARE AVAILABLE FOR RESEARCH PURPOSES, AND MANY BECOME PART OF PERMANENT AND TEMPORARY EXHIBITS OR ARE USED TO ENHANCE EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS. MEMBERSHIP SERVICES: THE MUSEUM HAS APPROXIMATELY 1,348 MEMBERSHIPS RANGING FROM INDIVIDUALS TO FAMILIES AND BUSINESSES. THESE MEMBERSHIPS ENCOMPASS MORE THAN 4,500 PEOPLE. MEMBERS ENJOY SPECIAL BENEFITS SUCH AS THE FIRST GLIMPSE OF A NEW FILM OR EXHIBIT.

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.ExplanationTxt: OTHER REVENUE 19,093 GROSS SALE OF INVENTORY 555,513

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE D, PAGE 1, PART III, LINE 1A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE MUSEUM OWNS A SIGNIFICANT COLLECTION OF SCIENCE, HISTORY AND ART OBJECTS THAT ARE NOT CAPITALIZED IN THE STATEMENTS OF FINANCIAL POSITION. THE MUSEUM UTILIZES ITS COLLECTIONS FOR PUBLIC BENEFIT THROUGH EDUCATION, EXHIBIT AND RESEARCH ACTIVITIES. APPROPRIATE ENVIRONMENTAL CONDITIONS AND STAFF ARE PROVIDED FOR THE PROPER CARE AND MANAGEMENT OF COLLECTIONS IN BOTH EXHIBIT AND STORAGE AREAS. ALL WORKS OF ART, HISTORICAL TREASURES AND LIBRARY COLLECTIONS ARE HELD FOR PUBLIC EXHIBITION, EDUCATION OR RESEARCH; ARE PROTECTED, KEPT UNENCUMBERED, CARED FOR AND PRESERVED AND ARE SUBJECT TO STRICT ORGANIZATIONAL POLICIES GOVERNING THEIR USE. THE VALUE OF THE MUSEUMS PERMANENT COLLECTION IS NOT SUBJECT TO REASONABLE ESTIMATION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE D, PAGE 2, PART III, LINE 4
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE MUSEUM COLLECTS OBJECTS AND NATURAL SCIENCE SPECIMENS TO PRESERVE THE REGION'S NATURAL AND HUMAN HISTORY AND PROVIDE EDUCATION AND ENRICHING EXPERIENCES THROUGH INTERPRETIVE EXHIBITS AND MUSEUM PROGRAMMING. THE COLLECTIONS PROVIDE INSIGHT INTO THE PAST, PRESENT, AND FUTURE EXPERIENCES OF THE PEOPLE IT SERVES. THE MUSEUM'S COLLECTION IS ORGANIZED INTO THE BROAD CATEGORIES OF NATURAL SCIENCES, REGIONAL HISTORY, ANTHROPOLOGY AND ARCHIVES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE D, PAGE 2, PART V, LINE 4
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: TO PROVIDE A PREDICTABLE STREAM OF FUNDING TO PROGRAMS SUPPORTED BY ITS ENDOWMENT WHILE SEEKING TO MAINTAIN THE PURCHASING POWER OF THE ENDOWMENT ASSETS.

THE MUSEUM HAS RECEIVED NOTIFICATION THAT IT QUALIFIES AS A TAX-EXEMPT ORGANIZATION UNDER SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE AND A SIMILAR SECTION OF THE STATE STATUTES AND, ACCORDINGLY, IS NOT SUBJECT TO FEDERAL OR STATE INCOME TAXES. EXCEPT ON ANY POTENTIAL UNRELATED BUSINESS NET INCOME. THE MUSEUM EVALUATES THE TAX BENEFITS OF A TAX POSITION USING THE "MORE LIKELY THAN NOT" THRESHOLD. AS OF JUNE 30, 2023, MANAGEMENT IS NOT AWARE OF ANY UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS AND RELATED TAX BENEFITS WHICH WOULD BE MATERIAL TO THE MUSEUM'S FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. THE MUSEUM FILES U.S. FEDERAL TAX RETURNS WHICH FOR FISCAL YEARS SUBSEQUENT TO 2019 ARE SUBJECT TO EXAMINATION BY TAXING AUTHORITIES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE D, PAGE 4, PART XI, LINE 2D
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: COSTS OF GOODS SOLD 94,412 RENTAL EXPENSE 20,576

THE PUTNAM EXISTS TO: PRESERVE OUR REGION'S TREASURES - TO CARE FOR AND UTILIZE THEM TO ILLUMINATE OUR HUMAN AND NATURAL HISTORY, AND TO EVOKE THE MEMORIES AND STORIES THE ARTIFACTS AND SPECIMENS TELL. EDUCATE PEOPLE OF ALL AGES IN IMMERSIVE AND LASTING WAYS WITH COMBINED "HANDS-ON, MINDS ON" EXPERIENCES THAT ONLY THE PUTNAM CAN PROVIDE. CONNECT PEOPLE TO EACH OTHER AND TO THE HISTORY AND SCIENCE THAT SHAPE THE CULTURES AND ENVIRONMENTS OF THE EARTH.

GIANT SCREEN THEATER: THE PUTNAM'S GIANT SCREEN THEATER OFFERS EDUCATIONAL AND TOPICAL FILMS AND PRESENTATIONS. EXAMPLES INCLUDE INTO AMERICA'S WILD, SUPERPOWER DOGS, BACK FROM THE BRINK, VOLCANOES 3D, OCEANS: OUR BLUE PLANET 3D, AND WILD AFRICA 3D. THE FILMS AND PRESENTATIONS ALLOW VIEWERS TO SEE NATURE IN ALL ITS GLORY, TO LEARN ABOUT HISTORY AND OTHER CULTURES, AND TO TRAVEL TO ALL PARTS OF THE WORLD. IN AN ERA WHEN ENVIRONMENTAL AWARENESS IS PART OF THE DAILY CONVERSATION AND GLOBAL CULTURES ARE INCREASINGLY INTERACTING VIA TECHNOLOGY, FILMS THAT ENLIGHTEN AND EDUCATE THE PUBLIC ABOUT A VARIETY OF ENVIRONMENTS AND CULTURES ARE SIGNIFICANT TO OUR ABILITY TO CO-EXIST PRODUCTIVELY.

COLLECTIONS AND CURATORIAL SERVICES: AN IMPORTANT PART OF THE MUSEUM'S MISSIONS IS PRESERVING THE COMMUNITY'S HISTORY. THE MUSEUM HOUSES APPROXIMATELY 170,000 CATALOGED ITEMS IN ITS PERMANENT COLLECTION. THESE ITEMS ARE EXPERTLY CARED FOR, ARE AVAILABLE FOR RESEARCH PURPOSES, AND MANY BECOME PART OF PERMANENT AND TEMPORARY EXHIBITS OR ARE USED TO ENHANCE EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS. MEMBERSHIP SERVICES: THE MUSEUM HAS APPROXIMATELY 1,348 MEMBERSHIPS RANGING FROM INDIVIDUALS TO FAMILIES AND BUSINESSES. THESE MEMBERSHIPS ENCOMPASS MORE THAN 4,500 PEOPLE. MEMBERS ENJOY SPECIAL BENEFITS SUCH AS THE FIRST GLIMPSE OF A NEW FILM OR EXHIBIT.

A DRAFT OF THE MUSEUM'S RETURN IS PROVIDED TO THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES. THEY ARE ASKED TO REVIEW IT AND DIRECT QUESTIONS TO THE BOARD CHAIRMAN. ANY NECESSARY CHANGES ARE MADE AND A FINAL VERSION IS SENT TO ALL BOARD MEMBERS PRIOR TO FILING THE RETURN

UPON ELECTION TO THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES, MEMBERS RECEIVE A COPY OF THE MUSEUM'S CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY. THE POLICY REQUIRES INTEREST AND ANNUAL REAFFIRM HIS OR HER UNDERSTANDING OF THE POLICY AND AGREEMENT TO COMPLY WITH IT. THIS ANNUAL AFFIRMATION IS DOCUMENTED THROUGH A CONFLICT OF INTEREST DISCLOSURE FORM WHICH THEY SIGN ELECTRONICALLY.

THE PROCESS FOR SETTING THE SALARY OF THE CEO RESTS WITH THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES. THE COMMITTEE REVIEW THE CEO'S COMPENSATION, KEEPING WRITTEN RECORDS OF ITS REVIEW, WHICH INCLUDES COMPARISON OF THE CEO'S SALARY TO THAT OF SIMILAR ORGANIZATIONS.
THE CEO DETERMINES THE SALARY OF ALL OFFICERS. THE COMPENSATION OF ALL OTHER EMPLOYEES ARE REVIEWED AND APPROVED BY THE CEO.
THE MUSEUM MAKES ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND ANNUAL AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE TO MEMBERS OF THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.
